Info:
Current weight and balance report including list of equipment included in certificated weight empty, and 
 loading instructions when necessary, must be in each aircraft at the time of original certification and at all times 
 thereafter (except in the case of air carrier operators having an approved weight control system).

Refer to Martin Engineering Reports "Actual Weight and Balance Model 404 (Airline)" and "Weight and 
 Balance Loading Schedule Model 404 (Airline)" for interior arrangement, equipment list, weight and balance 
 and loading schedule for any particular airplane.

"System Fuel and Oil" is that amount required to fill both the systems and the tanks up to the tank outlets to the 
 engines, when the airplane is in the level attitude. "System Fuel and Oil" and all hydraulic fluid must be 
 included in the certificated weight empty. (See Item 107 for fuel and oil quantities).

Fuel and Oil capacities listed do not include any "System Fuel and Oil". Oil tank does include propeller 
 feathering oil (2 gal.).
The following placards must be displayed on the instrument panel in full view of the pilot (except as noted in (c), (e)

"This airplane must be operated in compliance with operating limitations specified in F.A.A. approved airplane 
 operating manual."

Automatic Propeller Feathering: 
 "Lights ON for all take-off operations".

"Emergency gear extension - Do not lower above 130 m.p.h.". 
 (Located inside emergency gear control access door.)

Landing gear control handle: 
 "Caution: Lever must return to neutral after each operation".

Forward Cabin Door: 
 "This door to be open during all take-offs and landings". 
 (Located on forward side of cabin inner door at Sta. 330.)

Forward entrance door restraining bar (EAL only): 
 "Warning - Bar must not be across doorway during take-off and landing". 
 (Installed on restraining bar).

When antidetonant injection is not used for takeoff, the propeller governors must be reset prior to takeoff in order to 
 limit the dry takeoff engine r.p.m. to 2700.
